# areCursorRectsEnabled

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the window’s cursor rectangles are enabled.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var areCursorRectsEnabled: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] when cursor rectangles are enabled; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Related Documentation

- **addCursorRect(_:cursor:)**: Establishes  the cursor to be used when the mouse pointer lies within a specified region.

## Managing Cursor Rectangles

- **enableCursorRects()**: Reenables cursor rectangle management within the window after a [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/disableCursorRects()] message.
- **disableCursorRects()**: Disables all cursor rectangle management within the window.
- **discardCursorRects()**: Invalidates all cursor rectangles in the window.
- **invalidateCursorRects(for:)**: Marks as invalid the cursor rectangles of a given view object in the window, so they’ll be set up again when the window becomes key.
- **resetCursorRects()**: Clears the window’s cursor rectangles and the cursor rectangles of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView] objects in its view hierarchy.
